III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was observed to be unwashed, with dirty clothes. Youth
reported being physically abused by unnamed staff and had a
"busted lip".
Investigation On 8/15/24 the facility self-reported that Youth A ran away from
the facility. It was reported that Youth A ran away because he was
allegedly being abused by an unknown male staff member. Youth
A had a “busted lip”. Youth A had not bathed in several days and
had dirty clothes. While AWOL Youth A was observed in a “highly
drug infested” areas of the city and was chased by an unknown
woman with a knife.
Interviews:
MDHHS Worker informed DCWL on 8/15/24 that a visit was
completed with Youth A at the facility upon his return from AWOL.
Youth A was clean and did not have any marks or injuries.
Specifically, Youth A did not have a “busted lip”. MDHHS Worker
took a photo of where Youth A pointed to his lip and stated it was
“busted”. The photo was provided to DCWL. Youth A reported that
a peer caused the injury but did not provide further detail. Youth A
informed MDHHS Worker that no staff members had ever hit him
or put their hands on him. However, Staff 1, had threatened to hit
him before. Youth A went AWOL again after being interviewed.
Case Manager informed DCWL on 8/16/24 that Youth A returned
to the facility, along with Youth B. Both youths arrived in the car of
an unknown man. The man was extremely belligerent and
threatened staff. When Youth B got out of the vehicle, he had a
bruise to the face and a cut on his scalp. It was reported that
Youth B was “jumped” by a group of boys while AWOL. Youth B
2

refused medical care. Law Enforcement was notified of the
situation.
Chief Administrator was contacted by DCWL via email on
8/16/24, as they were out of the office for the week. Chief
Administrator provided an outline of events pertaining to Youth A
and Youth B. Chief Administrator reported that Youth A and Youth
B went AWOL at 9:40AM on 8/15/24. Around 12:40PM Youth A’s
mother contacted the agency to report she received a phone call
from a stranger, who stated they knew Youth A’s whereabouts.
The caller reported Youth A appeared abused, beaten and dirty.
The caller told Youth A’s mother that Youth A mentioned a male
staff member beat him, and he was afraid to return to the shelter.
After receiving this information, Chief Administrator reported this
information to law enforcement. Chief Administrator asked Law
Enforcement for assistance to pick up Youth A as there were
safety concerns about the location provided by the unknown caller
and due to the person’s motives being unknown. Around 1:00PM
Law Enforcement returned Youth A to the facility, where MDHHS
Worker met with him. Around 3:50PM Youth A went AWOL again.
At 7:20PM Youth A and Youth B returned to the facility
accompanied by an unknown man. It was unclear if this was the
previous unknown caller. Staff felt that the man was attempting to
exert control over Youth A. The man was belligerent and
threatening toward staff. Youth B was observed to have a bruise
on his face and his scalp was red. Youth B reported he was
“jumped” by a group of boys while AWOL. The incident was
reported to Law Enforcement. Youth B refused medical treatment.
Photos of the injuries were sent to DCWL along with a video of the
staff interaction with the unknown man. Around 7:30PM Youth A
and Youth B ran from the facility again and were observed getting
into the unknown man’s car. At 9:41PM Youth B returned to the
facility and again refused medical treatment. On 8/16/24 at
8:20AM Youth A returned to the facility, had breakfast, and took
his medication. Youth A informed staff that he was being picked
up by the unknown man again. Youth A stated the man was going
to drive him to Grand Rapids once Youth A’s grandmother sent
him $100. Staff encouraged Youth A to stay at the facility and
contacted law enforcement. However, Youth A went AWOL
around 8:40AM. Law Enforcement contacted the facility at
11:45AM and reported they had Youth A in their custody. Youth A
was dropped off at the station by an unknown person. Staff picked
Youth A up and took him back to the facility, where he refused
lunch and refused medical attention. Youth A and Youth B went
AWOL again around noon. The facility contacted DHHS staff and
3

requested replacement of both youth as the facility felt they were
unable to prevent the youth from going AWOL.
Chief Administrator noted that Youth A did not have any bruising
or injuries prior to leaving the facility. Chief Administrator did
indicate that Youth A does have a history of poor hygiene, despite
staff attempts to encourage him to bathe appropriately.
Staff 1 was interviewed on-site at the facility, on 8/19/24, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he was
familiar with Youth A. Youth A was placed at the facility two times
prior to this. Staff 1 stated that when Youth A returned to the
facility recently, he seemed like a different kid. Youth A previously
listened well to staff and had good rapport with everyone,
including Staff 1. This time, Youth A was saying a lot of things that
did not make sense. Youth A was going AWOL every day, no
matter what staff said or did to get him to stay. Staff were offering
outings, and rewards to encourage Youth A to stay at the facility.
However, staff were unsuccessful. Staff 1 stated he never hit or
threatened to hit Youth A, or any youth. Staff 1 said he never hurt
or put hands on Youth A or any youth. Staff 1 stated he never saw
any staff hit or injure youth. Staff 1 never observed any marks or
injuries on Youth A.
Staff 1 reported that hygiene was an ongoing struggle for Youth A.
Some staff were more successful than others, when encouraging
him to shower and brush his teeth.
Youth A could not be interviewed at the facility on 8/19/24, as he
was AWOL. Youth A was later discharged from the program
effective 8/16/24. Youth A was located and interviewed face-to-
face on 9/30/24 at Kent County Juvenile Detention center. Youth
A stated that he remembered going AWOL with Youth B while at
the facility. Youth A could not recall many details. When asked if
either youth had any injuries while away from the facility Youth A
could not recall specifically what happened. Youth A stated he
thought “a kid” hit him, but he was not sure of any details. Youth A
could not remember how Youth B was injured while in the
community. Youth A recalled “a man” in the community took both
youths back to the facility. However, Youth A could not remember
any details about the man. When asked about staff at the facility,
Youth A stated he did not like it there, but did not explain why.
Youth A denied any staff ever hitting him or observing staff hitting
other youth. Youth A denied ever being threatened by any staff.
Youth A reported when kids went AWOL from the facility, staff
followed them until they crossed a boundary in the neighborhood,
4

then the police were called to assist, and staff drove around
looking for youth.
Youth B could not be interviewed at the facility on 8/19/24, as he
was AWOL. Youth B was AWOL several times and could not be
interviewed until 9/20/24, when he returned to the facility. Youth B
reported he would go AWOL whenever he felt like it, because he
knew staff could not stop him. Youth B stated that staff would try
to talk youth out of leaving and would reward them for staying.
However, Youth B said he left whenever he wanted because he
liked to smoke. Youth B stated when kids left the facility, staff
followed the youth, but eventually stopped after a certain
boundary. Youth B stated staff stopped following because
community members did not like staff and threatened them.
Youth B recalled going AWOL with Youth A in August 2024. Youth
B stated Youth A left because he felt like it. Not because anything
happened. Youth B never witnessed any staff mistreat Youth A.
Youth B did not have any concerns about staff at the facility,
stating that staff look out for kids and try to keep them safe, even
though kids do not listen. Youth B did not recall Youth A having
any injuries while they were AWOL. Youth B did not want to
discuss his injuries during that time, other than to say he got into a
fight with some people in the community. Youth B reported he did
not think he needed to go to the hospital and refused when facility
staff tried to take him on 8/16/24.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 8/19/24, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he never
saw any staff harm or put their hands on any youth, including
Youth A. Youth C reported he never heard any staff threaten any
youth, including Youth A. Youth C reported that all residents
shower every day, or more often if needed. Youth C recalled that
Youth A would refuse showers at times. Regarding youth going
AWOL, Youth C stated that staff follow kids for a while, then drive
around looking for them and call the police for help.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 8/19/24, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported that he did
not recall any incidents between Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth D did
not observe any injuries to Youth A. Youth D did not express any
concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/20/24.
Staff 2 reported he never saw Youth A with an injured lip. Staff 2
never heard Youth A report any concerns about Staff 1. Staff 2 did
not have any concerns regarding Staff 1’s interactions with any
5

youth at the facility. Staff 2 recalled that Youth A and Youth B
went AWOL several times, despite staff attempts to encourage
them to stay. Staff 2 reported the agency policy was to follow
youth to a certain boundary by foot, then call law enforcement if
youth refuse to return.
Documents reviewed
• Photos were observed of Youth B’s injuries that he
received while AWOL. The skin under Youth B’s right eye
was bloodied and swollen. Youth B also appeared to have
an abrasion on the top of his head. Although it could not be
seen clearly due to his hair.
• Photos of Youth A’s lip taken by MDHHS Worker were
observed. No marks were noted.
• Incident report dated 8/15/24 for Youth A was reviewed.
The incident report indicated that staff attempted to verbally
redirect Youth A from going AWOL. Youth A then left and
Law Enforcement was contacted.
• Incident report dated 8/16/24 for Youth B was reviewed.
The incident report indicated staff attempted verbal
redirection with the youth and followed them off site. Law
Enforcement was then contacted.
• The human resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1
was up to date on all required training and did not have any
disciplinary action on file.
• The AWOL/Truancy Policy was reviewed. The policy states
that staff will verbally redirect youth and offer support and
alternatives to truancy. Staff will notify the supervisor on
duty when line of sight is lost, program manager and law
enforcement will also be contacted.
Analysis No violation was found. Based on interviews with youth and staff,
and review of photos and documents, there was no information to
support the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
